title: We cannot have bodily autonomy in a surveillance state
description: Jamelle Bouie – Opinion – September 2, 2023 …until the Supreme Court’s decision in Dred Scott v. Sandford settled the matter in favor of slaveholders, the status of an enslaved Black person outside a slave state was uncertain. It was unclear whether property in man extended beyond the borders of states where it was authorized […]

title: Weeknotes: Sept. 2-8, 2023
description: Stuff I did: 7 hours writing — frustrated with my pace, I talked shop with a friend, who helped me figure out some changes to try in my revision process Took Monday off for Labor Day Ordered a new mattress! Excited to get one that’s natural latex. (And can’t wait to get rid of the […]

title: Articles I read today: September 8, 2023
description: Continuing my tracking from yesterday — I’ll probably try to track my reading for four or five days. Lots of short articles today. Typos as a means for circumventing censorship by Victor Mair (UPenn Language Log) P&B: Rachel J. Kwon (Manuel Moreale) Back-to-School Energy for Writers by Hurley Winkler De-enshittifying digital photos by Giles Turnbull […]
